title: International Mathematical Union - Wikipedia
snippet: The International Mathematical Union (IMU) is an international organization devoted to international cooperation in the field of mathematics across the world. It is a member of the International Science Council (ISC) and supports the International Congress of Mathematicians (ICM).

title: | International Mathematical Union (IMU)
snippet: ICM 2026 Program Committee Chair Claire Voisin (CNRS, Institut de Mathématiques de Jussieu-Paris Rive Gauche) has been awarded the Crafoord Prize in Mathematics 2024 by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.

title: IMU Executive Committee | International Mathematical Union Leadership 2023-2026
snippet: Meet the IMU Executive Committee members leading the International Mathematical Union for 2023-2026. Learn about their roles and bios.

title: International Mathematical Union | international organization | Britannica
snippet: Other articles where International Mathematical Union is discussed: Lars V. Hörmander: …a vice president of the International Mathematical Union. In 1988 Hörmander was awarded the Wolf Prize.

title: Past ICMI Executive Committees | History & Members of ICMI Leadership
snippet: Since the establishment of ICMI during the fourth International Congress of Mathematicians held in Rome, 1908 the Executive Committees of the Commission (originally known as "Central Committees") have succeeded one another at intervals of approximately four years. A list of previous members and officials appears below.
